com.mobius.vdrapi.callbacks
Interface ICanPromptForPlaybackError

public interface ICanPromptForPlaybackError

A class implements ICanPromptForPlaybackError to enable it to prompt the user if an error occurs while trying to playback a script.

The PlaybackCommand calls this object when a script playback error occurs. The user must choose whether to continue. If the user does not wish to continue, this class throw a UserAbortException.

See Also:
PlaybackCommand, INeedPromptForPlaybackError

Method Summary
 void promptForPlaybackError(String playbackFile, String lineWithError, int lineNumber, Exception commandException)
          Prompts the user when a playback error occurs.
 

Method Detail

promptForPlaybackError

public void promptForPlaybackError(String playbackFile,
                                   String lineWithError,
                                   int lineNumber,
                                   Exception commandException)
                            throws ViewDirectException
Prompts the user when a playback error occurs. If the user chooses not to continue, this function throws a UserAbortException.

Parameters:
playbackFile - name of the script that is being played.
lineWithError - line of the script that has a problem.
lineNumber - number of the line in the file that has the error.
commandException - the exception that is thrown (that is causing an error).
Throws:
ViewDirectException - thrown if there is a problem in displaying the prompt, or if the playback should not continue.
